channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Infowars is going on the auction block
item.description: Proceeds will go toward paying what Alex Jones owes relatives of victims of the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting.

item.title: Two major analysts called this boring telecom stock their top pick in two days
item.description: JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs both named AT&T a top pick heading into earnings season in recent days.

item.title: Helene now a hurricane and expected to intensify as it approaches Florida
Stanley teams up with Barbie for the next giant mug obsession
Helene becomes a hurricane and is expected to intensify as it moves toward Florida
item.description: The storm is so large that rural areas roughly 90 miles (145 kilometers) north of the Georgia-Florida line are under a hurricane warning.

item.title: This family makes ‘really good money.’ And spends $70,000 of it on child care.
Rep. Miller: Raising the corporate tax rate will hurt American business, investment, and consumers
item.description: When the U.S. corporate tax rate was 35%, it was one of the highest corporate tax rates among developed countries.

item.title: An options trade that wins if Apple continues to trade sideways or down on iPhone, AI disappointment
item.description: Tony Zhang breaks down the sentiment around Apple's stock these days and how to trade it with options.

item.title: A bond-market warning for Qualcomm in its reported Intel pursuit
The Harris-Trump race is boiling down to capitalism vs. populism
item.description: The candidates are each emphasizing the economy at a time when polls show that it is one of the most important issues for voters.

item.title: SEC charges Merrill Lynch, Harvest Volatility Management for ignoring client investment limits
item.description: They will pay a combined $9.3 million after the Securities and Exchange Commission charged them for exceeding clients' investment limits over a two-ye...

item.title: Trump social-media stock ‘DJT’ rises with no insider sales reported to regulator
‘As painful as disruption is, it’s not negotiable’ says CarMax’s CEO
item.description: What's ahead for the used-car industry

item.title: New Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol commits to working with union as talks move forward
item.description: Workers United represents more than 490 of Starbucks' U.S. cafes and more than 10,000 of its employees.

item.title: U.S. new-home sales lower in August
